source.description: `commands` section: named command definitions for git hooks. Each command requires `run` option. Supports `skip`, `only`, `tags`, `glob`, `files`, `file_types`, `env`, `root`, `exclude`, `fail_text`, `stage_fixed`, `interactive`, `use_stdin`, `priority`.
Git hook configuration structure: available options for `pre-commit`, `pre-push`, and custom hooks including `files`, `parallel`, `piped`, `follow`, `skip`, `only`, `jobs`, `commands`, `scripts`.
Config file naming conventions: `lefthook.yml`, `.lefthook.yml`, `.config/lefthook.yml` in YAML, TOML, JSON formats. `lefthook-local` merge behaviour, options index for hooks, commands, scripts.

`scripts` section: external script files in `<source_dir>/<hook-name>/` directory. Requires `runner` option. Supports `skip`, `only`, `tags`, `env`, `fail_text`, `stage_fixed`, `interactive`, `use_stdin`, `priority`. Run `lefthook add -d` to create.
`assert_lefthook_installed` option: when `true`, exits with status 1 if lefthook executable not found in $PATH, node_modules, Ruby gems. Ensures hooks enforce lefthook rules.
`colors` option: enable, disable, or customise colorful output. Accepts `true`, `false`, `auto`, or custom hex/ANSI colour codes for cyan, gray, green, red, yellow. Overridable via `--colors` flag.
Remote `configs` option: array of config file paths to load from remote repository root. Default `[lefthook.yml]`. Merge multiple remote configurations from different sources.
`env` option: set environment variables for commands and scripts. Useful for extending `$PATH` in `lefthook-local.yml`, setting `RAILS_ENV`, cross-platform shell compatibility, GUI program hooks.
Job/command `exclude` option: glob patterns for files to exclude from `{staged_files}` or `{push_files}` templates. Affected by `glob_matcher` setting. Skips command if no files remain.
Hook `exclude_tags` option: skip commands matching specified tags or names. Overridable via `LEFTHOOK_EXCLUDE` env. Useful in `lefthook-local.yml` to disable specific commands locally.
`extends` option: merge external YAML config files using paths or glob patterns. Merge order: `lefthook.yml`, `extends`, `remotes`, `lefthook-local.yml`. Local config overrides everything.
`fail_on_changes` option: exit non-zero when git-tracked files are modified. Values: `never` (default), `always`, `ci` (only when CI env set), `non-ci`. Works with `stage_fixed`.
`fail_text` option: custom error message displayed when command or script fails. Useful for providing troubleshooting hints like adding executables to `$PATH`.

`file_types` option: filter files by type (`text`, `binary`, `executable`, `symlink`, `not symlink`, `not executable`) or MIME types (`text/x-python`, `text/x-sh`, `application/json`). AND logic for types, OR for MIME.
Hook-level `files` option: custom shell command returning files for `{files}` template. Empty result skips command execution. Set at hook level, applies to all commands.
`files` option: custom shell command providing file list for `{files}` template in `run`. Overwrites hook-level `files`. Skips execution when result is empty. Use with `git diff` or custom scripts.
Hook `follow` option: stream STDOUT output from running commands and scripts in real-time. Default `false`. Avoid combining with `parallel` to prevent interleaved output.
`git_url` option within `remotes`: specify Git repository URL for fetching remote config. Supports SSH (`git@github.com:...`) and HTTPS protocols. Uses machine privileges for access.
`glob` option: filter files by pattern for `run` templates. Supports `*.{ext}` syntax, array of patterns, `**` behaviour gotchas. Works with `root` option, auto-skips when no files match.
`glob_matcher` option: choose glob engine `gobwas` (default) or `doublestar`. Key difference: `**` matches 1+ directories in gobwas vs 0+ in doublestar. Affects `glob` and `exclude` patterns.

`group` option: nest jobs with shared execution settings. Configure `parallel`, `piped`, nested `jobs`. Inherits `env`, `root`, `glob`, `exclude` to child jobs. Use `name` for mergeability with local config.

`interactive` option: enable TTY input for commands/scripts. Opens `/dev/tty` as stdin. Runs after non-interactive unless `piped: true`. Disabled when `no_tty` is set. See `use_stdin` for non-CLI input.
`jobs` array: flexible task definitions supporting commands, scripts, and groups. Named jobs merge across configs; unnamed jobs append. Groups enable nested `parallel`/`piped` flow control.
`lefthook` option: specify custom executable path or command for running lefthook. Use cases include npm/pnpm PnP loaders, `bundle exec lefthook`, debug logging with `--verbose`.
`min_version` option: enforce minimum lefthook binary version requirement in `lefthook.yml`. Fails hook execution if installed version is older than specified semver value.
Job `name` option: identifier for job displayed in summary output. Named jobs can be merged/overridden in `lefthook-local.yml` or `extends` configs. Unnamed jobs are appended.
`no_tty` option: hide spinner and interactive elements during hook execution. Default `false`. Also controllable via `--no-tty` flag on `lefthook run` command.
`only` option: execute hooks, commands, or scripts only when conditions match. Opposite of `skip`. Same values: `rebase`, `merge`, `ref: branch`, `run: command`. `skip` takes precedence.

`output` option: control verbosity with values `meta`, `summary`, `empty_summary`, `success`, `failure`, `execution`, `execution_out`, `execution_info`, `skips`. Set `false` to disable all except errors. `LEFTHOOK_OUTPUT` env var support.
Hook `parallel` option: run commands and scripts concurrently instead of sequentially. Default `false`. Cannot combine with `piped: true` on same hook.
Hook `piped` option: stop running subsequent commands and scripts if one fails. Default `false`. Sequential execution with early exit on failure. Mutually exclusive with `parallel`.
`priority` option: set execution order (1 to infinity) for sequential commands/scripts. Only applies when `parallel: false` or `piped: true`. Default `0` means run last.
`rc` option: specify shell rc file for setting environment variables. Solves PATH issues with nvm, fnm, rbenv when hooks run from GUI programs like VSCode.
Remote `ref` option: specify branch or tag name for remote lefthook config fetching. Used in `remotes` array with `git_url` to pin specific versions.
Remote `refetch` option: force re-download of remote config on every lefthook run. Default `false`. Overrides cached remote configurations in `remotes` array.
Remote `refetch_frequency` option: control how often lefthook refetches remote configs. Values: `always`, `never`, or duration like `24h`, `30m`. Overridden by `refetch: true`.

`remotes` option: share lefthook configs across projects by downloading from remote Git repositories. Merge priority: `lefthook.yml`, `remotes`, `lefthook-local.yml`. Supports `extends` with relative paths.

`root` option: change working directory (CWD) for command execution. Filters file paths for `pre-push`/`pre-commit` hooks. Useful for monorepos with nested `package.json`. Globs still calculated from git root.

`run` option: shell command execution with file templates `{files}`, `{staged_files}`, `{push_files}`, `{all_files}`, `{cmd}`, git hook arguments `{0}`/`{N}`, quoting behaviour, command splitting for long file lists.
`runner` option for scripts: specifies command interpreter to execute script files, e.g. `node`, `bash`, `ruby`, `go run`. Called as `<runner> <path-to-script>`.
`script` option for jobs: specifies script filename from `source_dir` to execute, requires `runner` option, alternative to inline `run` commands for complex logic.
`skip` option: conditionally skip hooks, commands, or scripts. Values: `true`, `rebase`, `merge`, `merge-commit`, `ref: branch`, `run: command`. Supports glob patterns for branches.
`skip_lfs` option: skip running Git LFS hooks even when LFS is installed. Default `false`. Set `true` to bypass LFS hook execution.
`source_dir` option: customise directory for script files. Default `.lefthook/`. Contains subdirectories named after git hooks (`pre-commit/`, `pre-push/`) holding executable scripts.
`source_dir_local` option: customise directory for local scripts not stored in VCS. Default `.lefthook-local/`. Useful with `lefthook-local.yml` for personal script references.
`stage_fixed` option: automatically `git add` files after command/script execution in `pre-commit` hook. Uses `files` option or `{staged_files}` template. Applies `glob` and `exclude` filters.
`tags` option: assign labels to commands and scripts for filtering with `exclude_tags`. Multiple tags supported as array. Used for categorising by frontend, backend, language, style.
`templates` option: define custom placeholders for `run` values. Reduce redundancy with reusable wrappers like docker-compose commands. Override via `lefthook-local.yml` without rewriting jobs.
`use_stdin` option: pass OS stdin to command/script. Required for `pre-push` scripts using `while read` loops. Only one command receives data. Alternative to `interactive` for non-CLI input.

Commitlint and commitizen integration. `commit-msg` hook validates messages with `commitlint --edit`. `prepare-commit-msg` generates messages interactively using `cz --hook`. Conventional commits setup.
File filtering options for hooks: `glob` patterns, `exclude` patterns, `file_types` (e.g., `not executable`), `root` directory. Applied to `{staged_files}` before command execution.

`lefthook-local.yml` overrides and extends main `lefthook.yml` configuration. Add to `~/.gitignore` for local-only customisations like `parallel`, `skip`, wrapping commands with docker-compose, adding hooks.
`remotes` feature downloads and merges configurations from other Git repositories. Specify `git_url` and `configs` paths to share hook configurations across projects.
Conditional execution with `skip` and `only` options. Filter by `ref` branch patterns (e.g., `dev/*`, `main`) or custom `run` shell conditions like env variable checks.
`stage_fixed: true` auto-stages files modified by linters during `pre-commit` hook. Enables automatic staging of lint `--fix` changes for immediate commit.
Wrap commands from main `lefthook.yml` using `lefthook-local.yml` and `{cmd}` placeholder. Use with `dip` or `docker-compose run` for dockerised development environments.

CLI commands overview: `lefthook install`, `lefthook uninstall`, `lefthook add`, `lefthook run`, `lefthook version`, `lefthook self-update`, `lefthook validate`, `lefthook dump`. Use `lefthook help` or `--help` flag for options.
`lefthook add` command: installs specific Git hook. `--dirs` flag creates `.git/hooks/<hook>/` and `.lefthook/<hook>/` directories for custom shell scripts with `runner` option.
`lefthook check-install` command: verifies Git hooks installation status. Returns exit code `0` if installed and synchronised, `1` if missing or outdated.
`lefthook dump` command: prints complete merged configuration combining `lefthook.yml`, remotes, extends, and `lefthook-local.yml` overrides. Shows actual resolved config lefthook uses at runtime.
`lefthook install` command: creates empty `lefthook.yml` if missing, installs configured hooks to Git. NPM package auto-installs via postinstall. Supports installing specific hooks selectively.
`lefthook run` command: executes configured commands and scripts for hooks. Supports `--job`, `--tag` filtering, `--all-files`, `--file` options. Replaces `{staged_files}` templates.
`lefthook self-update` command: updates binary to latest GitHub release. Only available for source builds or direct binary downloads, not package managers.
`lefthook uninstall` command: removes all Git hooks previously installed by lefthook, clearing hook files from `.git/hooks/` directory in the repository.
`lefthook validate` command: validates `lefthook.yml` configuration against JSON schema from GitHub repository. Use with `lefthook dump` to inspect merged config.

Environment variables overview: `LEFTHOOK`, `LEFTHOOK_BIN`, `LEFTHOOK_OUTPUT`, `LEFTHOOK_VERBOSE`, `LEFTHOOK_CONFIG`, `LEFTHOOK_EXCLUDE`, `NO_COLOR`, `CLICOLOR_FORCE`, `CI`. Controls lefthook behaviour with CLI and config alternatives.
`CI=true` prevents lefthook NPM package from installing hooks in postinstall script. Override with `LEFTHOOK=1` to force installation despite CI environment.
`CLICOLOR_FORCE=true` forces coloured output in lefthook and all subcommands, overriding terminal colour detection. Useful for CI/CD pipelines requiring coloured logs.
`LEFTHOOK=0` or `LEFTHOOK=false` disables lefthook during git commands. `LEFTHOOK=1` forces hook installation in CI despite `CI=true`, useful for npm/yarn/pnpm postinstall scripts.
`LEFTHOOK_CONFIG` overrides main lefthook config file path, e.g., `LEFTHOOK_CONFIG=~/global_lefthook.yml`. Local config, extends, and remotes still load alongside the specified override.
`LEFTHOOK_EXCLUDE` skips commands or scripts by tag or command name. Accepts comma-separated list, e.g., `LEFTHOOK_EXCLUDE=ruby,security,lint`. Related to `exclude_tags` config option.
`LEFTHOOK_OUTPUT` controls output formatting and verbosity. Accepts comma-separated list of output values or `false` to suppress all output except errors. Example: `LEFTHOOK_OUTPUT=summary`.
`LEFTHOOK_VERBOSE=1` or `LEFTHOOK_VERBOSE=true` enables verbose printing mode for debugging lefthook execution, troubleshooting hook behaviour, and viewing detailed command and script output.
`NO_COLOR=true` disables coloured output in lefthook and all subcommands it executes. Standard environment variable for suppressing ANSI colour codes in terminal.
Features overview: local config overrides with `lefthook-local.yml`, Git argument passing, Git LFS support, interactive TTY commands, stdin passthrough for hooks.
Git argument passing: lefthook forwards Git hook arguments to commands and scripts. Access via `{1}`, `{2}`, `{3}` templates or shell positional parameters `$1`, `$2`, `$3`.
Git LFS integration: automatic LFS hook execution for `post-checkout`, `post-commit`, `post-merge`, `pre-push`. Disable with `skip_lfs: true`. Use `LEFTHOOK_VERBOSE` for debug output.
Interactive commands: `interactive: true` job option connects command or script to current TTY stdin, enabling user prompts and interaction during Git hook execution.
`lefthook-local.yml` local configuration: extends and overrides main `lefthook.yml`, gitignored personal settings, skip jobs, modify commands. Works standalone without main config.
Stdin passthrough: `use_stdin: true` option forwards Git stdin data to commands and scripts. Required for hooks like `pre-push` that receive data via stdin.
